headline: Dow slides, 30-year yield rises on CPI report, Newmont CFO departs
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Josh Lipton outlines the top stories of the trading session on Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. The 30-year Treasury yield (^TYX) rose above 5% after the June CPI report showed tariffs may be starting to drive prices higher. The data also weighed on stocks in the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI). The Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) is getting a boost after Nvidia (NVDA) said that it expects to be able to resume the sale of its H20 chip in China. Newmont (NEM) shares are trading lower after it was announced CFO Karyn Ovelmen has left the company. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Why Is First Solar (FSLR) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
summary: Shares of solar panel manufacturer First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) jumped 5.1% in the afternoon session after an analyst at Jefferies raised the price target for the company. The firm boosted its price target on First Solar to $194 from $192, while keeping a "Buy" rating on the shares. This move signals confidence in the company's future performance.

headline: Climate Tech Market Report 2025-2030, with Profiles of Orsted Services, Climeworks, Tesla, Vestas, Schneider Electric, QuantumScape Battery, Commonwealth Fusion Systems, First Solar, and more
summary: The Climate Tech Market is set to grow from USD 38.50 billion in 2024 to USD 115.40 billion by 2030 (CAGR 20.90%). Key drivers include rising carbon neutrality regulations, increased investments in renewable energy, and corporate sustainability commitments. The report offers insights into market segmentation by end-user, technology, and region, along with future trends and strategic recommendations for growth. headline: First Solar, Inc. to Announce Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results on July 31, 2025
summary: TEMPE, Ariz., July 15, 2025--First Solar, Inc. (NASDAQ: FSLR) (the "Company") will report financial results for the second quarter ended June 30, 2025, after the market closes on Thursday, July 31, 2025.

headline: This Week In Energy Transition - Innovative Solutions Propel Solar Expansion in Italy
summary: Solargik has announced new developments in Italy's solar energy sector by signing 85 megawatts (MW) of utility-scale solar projects, aimed at harnessing solar power in regions previously considered unsuitable due to steep or complex terrains. Collaborating with Revalue and Free Ingegneria, the initiative includes projects that employ terrain-adaptive and AgriPV-compatible solar trackers, enabling solar deployment on challenging landscapes and agricultural areas. This expansion is expected to...
